data.event: Lt. Lavrenty Zagoskin, from the Imperial Russian Navy sent to Alaska to scout locations for trading posts, reported the village as "Ikalikguigmyut" in 1842.

event.title: 1867, the Mission Covenant of Sweden established

data.event: In 1867, the Mission Covenant of Sweden established a church and school south of the current site of Golovin.
Around 1890, John Dexter established a trading post that became the center for swapping prospecting information for the entire Seward Peninsula.
Gold was discovered in 1898 at Council and Golovin became a supply point for the gold fields.
